http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: This ontology represents the  terms to allow interoperability in DELTA project. It models concepts related to enery market, smart grids and demand-response platforms, and it will reuse standard ontologies whenever possible.
Action that is requested by a FEID
Legal entities that aggregate the load or generation of various demand and/or generation/production units and aim at optimizing energy supply and consumption.
Aggrupation of elements, such as FEIDs or Virtual Nodes
Entity that consumes energy
Entity that interacts in the platform
Groups of customers

An intelligent device, responsible for collecting information stemming from the field devices (home appliances, distributed energy resources, storage components etc.) to the DELTA Virtual Nodes and facilitate end-to-end communication of signals from/to the Aggregator and to/from the field devices. FEIDs will be equipped with smart meters measuring energy related data (e.g. consumption, generation, emissions, power coefficient, etc.) and through an intelligent lightweight toolkit compute real-time flexibility, providing them as input to the DVN Agent using fog computing techniques, aligned to a strategy (i.e. time interval) imposed to the specific Node by the Aggregator.
Frequency constraint related to the grid
Incentive (usually monetary) associated to energy values
Reliability and Fairness Index that refers to the distribution network configuration
Monetary value associated to a contract
A specification associated to a Virtual Node or a device to collect information about properties
Entity that consumes or produces energy
Reward associated to the customers that is given after using the engagement tools
Reward associated to the customers that is given after using the engagement tools (e.g., discounts)
A section or zone
Transaction between entities that will be store in the blockchain
Violation of the grid

An aggregated, virtual cluster of prosumers which will be perceived and acted upon as a single, large prosumer entity by the Aggregator. Prosumers entailed into each Virtual Node will have common characteristics, defined by their corresponding Aggregator.
Voltage constraint related to the grid
Description of a cluster
Name of a cluster

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Relationship between the FEID and the violation it detects

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: granularity of the profile (e.g., weekly, daily)
Relationship identifying the properties associated to a group of entities, such as clusters
Link between a price and its currency
Duration of an event
URI of the endpoint
A relation between a property and its incentives associated
Link between a Virtual Node and its index
IP address of a thing
Date when a DR request is sent
Points that are used by the DELTA platform to calculate the customers rewards
Address of the service within the system.
Link between an entity and its profile
Redundancy of  a FEID
Link between a customer and its associated reward
link between the Virtual node and its smart contracts
DR type that is implemented by the FEID (e.g., implicit or explicit)
Relationship between a violation and  a profile that describes such violation
Link from a virtual node to its aggregator
Availability of a FEID
Relation between an object and the geographical feature in which it is located at
Link between a device and its customer
Period where an entity, such a contract, is valid
Relation between a Virutal Node and the  devices it manages
Link between the customers and the devices
Relationship between a grid violation and the DR request to solve it.
Relationship between a DR request and the needed measurement in order to solve a violation
The final status as if the DVN fullfiled the request or it failed
This class represents the top-level feature type. This class is equivalent to GFI_Feature defined in ISO 19156:2011, and it is superclass of all feature types.
The class represents the top-level geometry type. This class is equivalent to the UML class GM_Object defined in ISO 19107, and it is superclass of all geometry types.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#isD.@value: A spatial representation for a given feature.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A temporal entity with zero extent or duration
A temporal entity with an extent or duration
A temporal interval or instant.

A tangible object designed to accomplish a particular task in households, common public buildings or offices. In order to accomplish this task, the device performs one or more functions. For example, a washing machine is designed to wash (task) and to accomplish this task it performs a start and stop function. Devices can be structured in categories (subclasses) that reflect the different domain in which a device is used, e.g., smart appliances domain (subclass FunctionRelated) vs. building domain (subclass BuildingRelated) vs. smart grid domain (subclass EnergyRelated). New categories can be defined,if needed, to reflect other differences, for example different points of view, such as the point of view of the device's user vs. the point of view of the device's manufacturer. We propose a list of devices that are relevant for the purpose of SAREF, but this list can be extended.
A property related to measurements that are characterized  by a value measured in energy units
A property related to measurements that are characterized  by a value measured in power units

A specification associated to a device to collect information about a certain Property (e.g., Energy) or Commodity (e.g.Water) for optimizing its usage in the home, office or building in which the device is located. This specification is about a certain Property or Commodity (saref:isAbout), can be calculated over a time span (saref:hasTime ) and can be associated to some costs (saref:hasPrice). An example is the Power Profile defined in the SAREF4ENER extension that can be associated to a device for optimizing the Energy efficiency in the home, office or building in which the device is located.
A relationship identifying what an entity, such as a Profile, is about
